img.alt: Wakeland Ensembles Invited to Prestigious Clinic

li.a: Wakeland Ensembles Invited to Prestigious Clinic

ul.li: Congratulations to the Wakeland High School Wind Symphony and Percussion Ensemble who have both been invited to perform at the Midwest International Band and Orchestra Clinic.

img.alt: FISD Applause! Applause!

ul.li: Frisco ISD is proud to applaud our students and staff for special awards and recognition they have received in recent weeks. Remember to share your congratulations with them!

img.alt: Summer Learning and Enrichment to Take Place Online

li.a: Summer Learning and Enrichment to Take Place Online

ul.li: Online instruction is the best way to ensure student safety while maintaining summer programs. Registration for secondary summer school begins May 4.

img.alt: Frisco ISD Is Thankful for Veteran Staff

li.a: Frisco ISD Is Thankful for Veteran Staff

ul.li: Each spring, the District reflects on the appreciation it has for the staff who work day in and day out for the benefit of students across Frisco ISD.

img.alt: Meet Five Individuals Making a Difference During This Pandemic

li.a: Meet Five Individuals Making a Difference During This Pandemic

ul.li: Frisco ISD is full of people who strive to make the world a better place. These students and staff are making a difference right now.

img.alt: District Announces Top 10 Teachers of the Year

li.a: District Announces Top 10 Teachers of the Year

ul.li: Congratulations to the Top 10 Teachers of the Year who were announced by Superintendent Dr. Mike Waldrip during a Facebook live stream Thursday evening.

img.alt: Teachers Work from Afar to Make Birthdays Special for Students

li.a: Teachers Work from Afar to Make Birthdays Special for Students

ul.li: Educators continue to celebrate these important milestones to show students how much they care.

img.alt: District Athletics and Facility Use Suspended Through School Year

li.a: District Athletics and Facility Use Suspended Through School Year

ul.li: In response to the battle against COVID-19 (Coronavirus), all Frisco ISD athletic events and facility usage have been suspended through the end of the 2019-20 school year.

img.alt: eLearning to Continue Through End of the 2019-20 School Year

li.a: eLearning to Continue Through End of the 2019-20 School Year

ul.li: Frisco ISD will continue its suspension of in-person learning and will continue eLearning through the end of the calendared 2019-20 school year.

img.alt: Frisco ISD eNewsletter: April 16, 2020

ul.li: In this Issue: Grades Provide Feedback to Students, Special Education Provides Sense of Normalcy, FISD Distributes Books to Students and more.

img.alt: Music Therapy Brings Sense of Normalcy to Students

li.a: Music Therapy Brings Sense of Normalcy to Students

ul.li: The continuity of special education services is helping students progress with their unique educational goals and also providing consistency for students during an uncertain time.

img.alt: Frisco ISD is a 2020 Best Community for Music Education

li.a: Frisco ISD is a 2020 Best Community for Music Education

ul.li: For the fourth straight year, Frisco ISD has been recognized as one of the Best Communities for Music Education in the United States.

img.alt: A Letter from the Chief Academic Officer

li.a: A Letter from the Chief Academic Officer

ul.li: Chief Academic Officer Dr. Wes Cunningham explains how eLearning impacts grading, progress reports, retention, dual credit and state assessments in a letter to parents.

img.alt: Frisco ISD eNewsletter: April 9, 2020

ul.li: In this Issue: Help Stop the Spread, Don’t Forget School Holidays in April, FISD Holds Pre-Kindergarten Registration and more.

img.alt: FISD Partners Help Students Get Needed School Supplies

li.a: FISD Partners Help Students Get Needed School Supplies

ul.li: The Frisco ISD community is spending time apart to combat the spread of COVID-19, but that can’t diminish its spirit of togetherness. That showed as two churches stepped in to help FISD get school supplies to students.

li.a: HOSA Students Qualify for Virtual National Competition

ul.li: Frisco ISD students will compete in the HOSA National Leadership Conference to be held virtually June 24-27.

li.a: Student-Athletes Help Community During Challenging Time

ul.li: Frisco ISD student-athletes had their spring seasons cut short, and in some cases, but the disappointment they felt didn’t keep them from realizing the even greater effects on others in their community.

li.a: Staley Middle School Earns Digital Citizenship Certification

ul.li: Staley Middle School has been honored for helping students and families thrive in a world of digital media and technology

li.a: Lebanon Trail FCCLA Student Qualifies for Nationals

ul.li: Congratulations to Lebanon Trail High School senior Alec Zorilla, who took gold at the Texas Family Career and Community Leaders of America State Competition.

li.a: Healthy Snack Challenge Benefits FISD P.E., Culinary Arts Programs

ul.li: Frisco ISD is receiving a $12,000 donation for its physical education and culinary arts programs as one of the winners of the Kids Teaching Kids 21-Day Healthy Snack Challenge.

li.a: Liberty Student News Website Wins National Awards for Excellence

ul.li: Liberty High School’s Wingspan is a five-time winner of the National Scholastic Press Association’s Pacemaker and a four-time winner of a Gold Crown by the Columbia Scholastic Press Association.

li.a: In Celebration of Literacy, K-2 Students Receive Books

ul.li: Library Services coordinated with Federal Programs to make sure that the books found a place in the homes of kindergarten through second grade students.

li.a: Claudia Sunday Named State Diving Coach of the Year

ul.li: Congratulations to Frisco ISD Diving Coach Claudia Sunday, who has been named the State Diving Coach of the Year by the Texas Interscholastic Swim Coaches Association.

li.a: HOSA Names Frisco ISD Students as Officers

ul.li: Five Frisco ISD high school students have been named to leadership roles for HOSA - Future Health Professionals.

li.a: Donated Masks Provide Added Safety for Frisco ISD Workers

ul.li: As essential workers continue their work within Frisco ISD, the District is thankful to the business partner and community organizations who have offered assistance.

li.a: A&M’s Newest FISD Student is Extraordinary

ul.li: Congratulations to Callie Colgrove on her admission to Texas A&M University's Aggie ACHIEVE program.

li.a: Three Students Named Finalists in Scholarship Art Contest

ul.li: Vote now to help a student from Centennial, Heritage or Memorial high schools win a college scholarship.

li.a: Frisco ISD is Thankful for the Gift of Polly Tadlock

ul.li: Polly Tadlock, the namesake for Tadlock Elementary, passed of natural causes this past weekend.

li.a: Rogers Students Take the Lead With Innovation Day

ul.li: Preparing students to explore new ways to engage with technology has been a central goal of Frisco ISD way before eLearning took hold.

li.a: Frisco ISD Honors the Legacy of Reba Cobb-Carroll

ul.li: Reba Cobb-Carroll, school namesake and legendary Frisco ISD staff member, passed away of natural causes this past week.

div.p: Our mission is to know every student by name and need.
